Description: Terrracotta model of a tragic mask. A large model of a tragic mask, heavily bearded, with long hair parted in the centre. The brows are drawn together, the nose is ridged and the eyes are wide. The pupils of the eyes are cut out, as also is the slightly opened mouth. Three holes are pierced for the attachment of the object, one on each side approximately at ear level, the other above the brow. The beard on the left side of the head has been restored in plaster. Pressed into a one-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt, coated on the outside with a thin matt brown slip, runs of which can be seen inside.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3563)
